refnamediv.refpurpose: Widget for packing a list of selectable items

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Signals
refsect1.synopsis: "select-child" : Run First "selection-changed" : Run First "unselect-child" : Run First

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GtkList widget is a container whose children are displayed vertically in order, and can be selected. The list has many selection modes, which are programmer selective and depend on how many elements are able to be selected at the same time.
GtkList has been deprecated since GTK+ 2.0 and should not be used in newly written code. Use GtkTreeView instead.

warning.para: GtkList is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_new ()

warning.para: gtk_list_new is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkList.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_insert_items ()

warning.para: gtk_list_insert_items is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Inserts items into the list at the position position. The GList items must not be freed after.

listitem.simpara: the position to insert items, starting at 0.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_append_items ()

warning.para: gtk_list_append_items is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Adds items to the end of the list.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_prepend_items ()

warning.para: gtk_list_prepend_items is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Inserts items at the beginning of the list.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_remove_items ()

warning.para: gtk_list_remove_items is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Removes the items from the list.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_remove_items_no_unref ()

warning.para: gtk_list_remove_items_no_unref is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Removes the items from the list, without unreferencing them. It may be useful if you want to move the items from one list to another.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_clear_items ()

warning.para: gtk_list_clear_items is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Removes the items between index start (included) and end (excluded) from the list. If end is negative, or greater than the number of children of list, it's assumed to be exactly the number of elements. If start is greater than or equal to end, nothing is done.

listitem.simpara: the index of the first item to remove.
the index of the lest item to remove plus one.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_select_item ()

warning.para: gtk_list_select_item is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Selects the child number item of the list. Nothing happens if item is out of bounds. The signal GtkList::select-child will be emitted.

listitem.simpara: the index of the child to select.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_unselect_item ()

warning.para: gtk_list_unselect_item is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Unselects the child number item of the list. Nothing happens if item is out of bounds. The signal GtkList::unselect-child will be emitted.

listitem.simpara: the index of the child to unselect.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_select_child ()

warning.para: gtk_list_select_child is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Selects the given child. The signal GtkList::select-child will be emitted.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_unselect_child ()

warning.para: gtk_list_unselect_child is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Unselects the given child. The signal GtkList::unselect-child will be emitted.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_child_position ()

warning.para: gtk_list_child_position is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Searches the children of list for the index of child.

listitem.simpara: the index of the child, -1 if not found.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_set_selection_mode ()

warning.para: gtk_list_set_selection_mode is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para:
Set the list selection mode. The selection mode can be any value in ""
GTK_SELECTION_SINGLE
Zero or one element may be selected.
GTK_SELECTION_BROWSE
Exactly one element is always selected (this can be false after you have changed the selection mode).
GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE
Any number of elements may be selected. Clicks toggle the state of an item.
GTK_SELECTION_EXTENDED
Any number of elements may be selected. Click-drag selects a range of elements; the Ctrl key may be used to enlarge the selection, and Shift key to select between the focus and the child pointed to.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_extend_selection ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_list_extend_selection (GtkList *list, GtkScrollType scroll_type, gfloat position, gboolean auto_start_selection);

warning.para: gtk_list_extend_selection is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Extends the selection by moving the anchor according to scroll_type. Only in GTK_SELECTION_EXTENDED.

listitem.simpara: the position if scroll_type is GTK_SCROLL_JUMP.
if TRUE, gtk_list_start_selection() is automatically carried out before extending the selection.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_start_selection ()

warning.para: gtk_list_start_selection is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Starts a selection (or part of selection) at the focused child. Only in GTK_SELECTION_EXTENDED mode.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_end_selection ()

warning.para: gtk_list_end_selection is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Ends the selection. Used with gtk_list_extend_selection() and gtk_list_start_selection(). Only in GTK_SELECTION_EXTENDED mode.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_select_all ()

warning.para: gtk_list_select_all is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Selects all children of list. A signal will be emitted for each newly selected child.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_unselect_all ()

warning.para: gtk_list_unselect_all is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Unselects all children of list. A signal will be emitted for each newly unselected child.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_scroll_horizontal ()

warning.para: gtk_list_scroll_horizontal is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Scrolls list horizontaly. This supposes that the list is packed into a scrolled window or something similar, and adjustments are well set. Step and page increment are those from the horizontal adjustment of list. Backward means to the left, and forward to the right. Out of bounds values are truncated. scroll_type may be any valid GtkScrollType. If scroll_type is GTK_SCROLL_NONE, nothing is done. If it's GTK_SCROLL_JUMP, the list scrolls to the ratio position: 0 is full left, 1 is full right.

listitem.simpara: the position if scroll_type is GTK_SCROLL_JUMP

refsect2.title: gtk_list_scroll_vertical ()

warning.para: gtk_list_scroll_vertical is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Scrolls list vertically. This supposes that the list is packed into a scrolled window or something similar, and adjustments are well set. Step and page increment are those from the vertical adjustment of list. Backward means up, and forward down. Out of bounds values are truncated. scroll_type may be any valid GtkScrollType. If scroll_type is GTK_SCROLL_NONE, nothing is done. If it's GTK_SCROLL_JUMP, the list scrolls to the ratio position: 0 is top, 1 is bottom.

listitem.simpara: the position if scroll_type is GTK_SCROLL_JUMP

refsect2.title: gtk_list_toggle_add_mode ()

warning.para: gtk_list_toggle_add_mode is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Toggles between adding to the selection and beginning a new selection. Only in GTK_SELECTION_EXTENDED. Useful with gtk_list_extend_selection().

refsect2.title: gtk_list_toggle_focus_row ()

warning.para: gtk_list_toggle_focus_row is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Toggles the focus row. If the focus row is selected, it's unselected. If the focus row is unselected, it's selected. If the selection mode of list is GTK_SELECTION_BROWSE, this has no effect, as the selection is always at the focus row.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_toggle_row ()

warning.para: gtk_list_toggle_row is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Toggles the child item of list. If the selection mode of list is GTK_SELECTION_BROWSE, the item is selected, and the others are unselected.

refsect2.title: gtk_list_undo_selection ()

warning.para: gtk_list_undo_selection is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Restores the selection in the last state, only if selection mode is GTK_SELECTION_EXTENDED. If this function is called twice, the selection is cleared. This function sometimes gives stranges "last states".

refsect2.title: gtk_list_end_drag_selection ()

warning.para: gtk_list_end_drag_selection is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Stops the drag selection mode and ungrabs the pointer. This has no effect if a drag selection is not active.

refsect2.title: The "selection-mode" property
refsect2.para: Default value: GTK_SELECTION_NONE

refsect2.title: The "select-child" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkList *list, GtkWidget *widget, gpointer user_data) : Run First
refsect2.para: The child widget has just been selected.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "selection-changed" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkList *list, gpointer user_data) : Run First
refsect2.para: The selection of the widget has just changed.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "unselect-child" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkList *list, GtkWidget *widget, gpointer user_data) : Run First
refsect2.para: The child widget has just been unselected.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

listitem.para: For functions that apply to every GtkContainer (like GtkList).
Children of a GtkList widget must be of this type.
